description._content: ID: 020975 Title: Travels through Virginia. [ From Theodor de Bry's 'America', Vol. I, 1590, after a drawing of John White]. Author: "Strachey, William (William Strachey)", "Bry, Theodor de (Theodor de Bry)" Illustrator: "White, John; Bry, Theodor de (John White; Theodor de Bry)", "Bry, Theodor de (Theodor de Bry)" Provenance: England; 1618 Caption: 'Their sitting at meate'. Engraving of two figures seated on a strip of matting, eating with their right hands from a large circular dish containing grains of food. The woman wears a necklace of beads, and a fringed skin robe over her left shoulder. The man wears a fringed deerskin mantle. On the mat is a gourd water vessel with carved out handle, skin bag, tobacco pipe, walnut, fish, four ears of maize, and a scallop shell. Language: English Source identifier: Sloane 1622, f.85 British Library Shelfmark: Sloane 1622 If you wish to purchase a high quality copy of this image, please place an order at Images Online imagesonline.bl.uk. The details from the above list should help you locate the images.
